title: Oil prices rise on fears of wider Middle East conflict after rocket strike in Golan Heights
message:
TOKYO, July 29 (Reuters) - Oil prices rose on Monday, paring last week's loss, on fears of a widening conflict in the Middle East following a rocket strike in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, which Israel and the United States blamed on Lebanese armed group Hezbollah.
Brent crude futures gained 20 cents, or 0.3%, to $81.33 a barrel at 0010 GMT.
U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures climbed 9 cents, or 0.1%, to $77.25 a barrel.
Last week, Brent lost 1.8% while WTI fell 3.7% on sagging Chinese demand and hopes of a Gaza ceasefire agreement.
That conflict has spread to several fronts and risks spilling into a wider regional conflict.

title: The Times view on efforts to end civil war : Sudan Agony
message:
Supporters of the Sudanese armed popular resistance, which supports the army, ride through Gedaref AFP/GETTY IMAGESThe civil war in Sudan is one of the most brutal, destructive and pointless conflicts in the world.
It has been raging for more than a year, killing ­hundreds of thousands of civilians, destroying cities, forcing about 12 million people from their homes and causing more than two million Sudanese to flee the country.
An epidemic of violence has led to mass rapes and thousands of women being forced into child marriage or sexual slavery.
The United States and Saudi Arabia are ­attempting to get government and rebel leaders together in Switzerland next month to agree a ceasefire.
But no attempt to halt the war or start peace negotiations has yet shown any effect.
event_breakdown: Sudan's civil war has been going on for more than a year and has resulted in the deaths of hundreds of thousands of people and forced millions of Sudanese to flee the country. A ceasefire is being attempted next month, but previous attempts to halt the war and start peace negotiations have shown no effect.

title: Air Defense Forces Shot Down One Enemy Missile , Nine Shahed Uavs Overnight
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) On the night of July 29, 2024, the enemy attacked Ukraine with a Kh-59/Kh-69 guided missile launched from the airspace of occupied Donetsk region and 10 Shahed-type strike UAVs from Cape Chauda, Crimea.
Ukrainian Air Force Commander, Lieutenant General Mykola Oleshchuk said this in a post on Telegram , Ukrinform reports.
One Kh-59/Kh-69 guided missile and nine Shahed-131/136 UAVs were intercepted and shot down in the Dnipropetrovsk, Kherson and Kirovohrad regions.
guards hit two Russian positions in Zaporizhzhia sectoAnti-aircraft missile and EW units of the Air Force and mobile fire groups of the Ukrainian Defense Forces were involved in repelling the air attack.

The guided missile and eight of the UAVs were shot down by Ukrainian air defenses over the Dnipropetrovsk, Kherson and Kirovohrad regions. title: A wake - up call for Korea frozen legislature
message:
By Park Jin-wanAs the newly elected 22nd National Assembly settles its role, a disturbing trend has emerged: complete legislative inertia.
This stagnation represents a worrying trend in South Korea's parliamentary function.
For over a month since its inception, two parties have conflicted over the leadership allocation of standing committees.
The art of governance has devolved into a zero-sum game of political brinkmanship, with national welfare becoming collateral damage.
South Korea's present and future hangs in the balance, and with it, the hopes and aspirations of its people.

North Korea test-launches suspected ICBM
Event: North Korea test-launches suspected intercontinental ballistic missile
Date: March 24, 2022
Location: North Korea
Description: North Korea fired a suspected intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) on Thursday, its first such test since 2017, according to South Korea and Japan.
The missile was launched from Jagang province, in the north of the country, towards the east, and flew for about 71 minutes to an altitude of about 6,200 km (3,900 miles) and a distance of about 1,000 km (621 miles) into the sea The Japanese government said.
The Japanese coast guard warned vessels in nearby waters about the launch, which was the first since 2017, and advised them to move further south.
The Japanese prime minister, Fumio Kishida, strongly condemned the launch, calling it “a threat to peace and security” in the region.
US and South Korean officials said they detected the launch and were working to gather more intelligence.
The South Korean president, Moon Jae-in, had a telephone conversation with Joe Biden in which the US president expressed “deep concern” about the launch and urged Pyongyang to refrain from further provocations.

title: Shifting Sands : A Battle Song exhibition catalogue launch - Announcements
message:
The Saudi Visual Arts Commission is pleased to announce the publication of Shifting Sands: A Battle Song, a richly illustrated hardcover catalogue that celebrates the multimedia installation by Manal AlDowayan at the National Pavilion of Saudi Arabia at the 60th International Venice Biennale (April 20–November 24, 2024).
Together, the essays address matters surrounding visions of womanhood today both in Saudi Arabia and globally.
Cerasi’s essay, “A Rallying Cry”, offers an insightful analysis of Shifting Sands: A Battle Song by illustrating how AlDowayan uses the metaphor of the shifting desert sands to reflect the dynamic cultural landscape of Saudi Arabia.
The catalogue, Shifting Sands: A Battle Song, is available for download at saudipavilion.orgTo order a copy of Shifting Sands: A Battle Song, click here.
Shifting Sands: A Battle Song is available for purchase at the Venice Biennale bookshop in the Central Pavilion, Giardini and in the Corderie, Arsenale.

title: Ukrainians demand prisoner release | The Arkansas Democrat - Gazette
message:
KYIV, Ukraine -- Ukrainians urged their government to do more to get Russia to release prisoners of war, voicing their anger on Sunday at a ceremony commemorating the second anniversary of an explosion that killed more than 50.
The Olenivka explosion was one of the most painful pages in the war, according to many soldiers.
Russia has claimed that the Olenivka explosion was caused by Ukrainian forces firing a missile that hit the prison barracks.
But increasing evidence suggests that Russian forces set off the explosion, according to an investigation by The Associated Press.
Two years after the explosion, many Ukrainians still want to know exactly how it happened.

title: Hezbollah Evacuates Positions Ahead of Anticipated Israeli Raids
message:
Hezbollah has vacated positions in southern and eastern Lebanon following Israeli threats of retaliation for a deadly strike in the annexed Golan Heights, according to a source close to the group.
Israel accused Hezbollah of launching a Falaq-1 Iranian rocket, but the Iran-backed group, which frequently targets Israeli military positions, denied any involvement in the incident.
Hezbollah has a significant presence in the Bekaa Valley near the Syrian border and in southern Lebanon, where it has been conducting near-daily attacks on Israeli positions in support of Hamas since October.
Earlier in June, Hezbollah had already abandoned some positions in Syria following Israeli raids, according to the Observatory.
Israeli strikes have killed at least 25 Hezbollah fighters in Syria since the Gaza conflict began, according to an AFP count.

title: Hezbollah evacuates positions ahead of expected Israel raids
message:
Hezbollah has evacuated positions in south and east Lebanon after Israeli threats of reprisals for a deadly strike on the annexed Golan Heights, a source close to the group said.
Israel blamed Lebanon's Hezbollah movement for firing a Falaq-1 Iranian rocket but the Iran-backed group -- which has regularly targeted Israeli military positions -- said it had "no connection" to the incident.
Hezbollah had already abandoned positions in Syria in early June after Israeli raids, according to the Britain-based Observatory, which relies on a network of sources on the ground.
Since Syria's civil war erupted in 2011, Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes in the country, mainly targeting army positions and Iran-backed fighters, including from Hezbollah.
Israeli strikes have killed at least 25 Hezbollah fighters in Syria since the Gaza war erupted, according to an AFP tally.

title: Due to war : IDF acquires precision - guided mortars - at a cost of $190m
message:
Eyal Zamir, has signed an order worth over $220 million for thousands of "Iron Sting" precision-guided mortar munitions from Elbit Systems.
These advanced precision-guided munitions (PGMs) are set to enhance the operational capabilities of the IDF's ground forces.
"Iron Sting" PGMs are equipped with sophisticated laser and GPS guidance systems, enabling precise targeting while minimizing collateral damage and reducing the risk to non-combatants.
These advanced munitions represent a significant leap in the IDF's ability to conduct operations in complex combat conditions and urban environments.
This initiative aims to ensure that IDF forces are equipped with the most advanced and effective ammunition, enhancing their operational efficiency and safety.
